definitions.definition: To rush , flood , or increase suddenly.

examples: A ship surges forwards, sways sideways and heaves up.

definitions.definition: To experience a momentary reversal of airflow through the compressor section due to disruption of intake airflow.
examples: Use of maximum reverse thrust at low speeds can cause the engine to surge from ingesting its own exhaust.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , aviation , of a jet engine

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To rush , flood , or increase suddenly.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , aviation , of a jet engine ) To experience a momentary reversal of airflow through the compressor section due to disruption of intake airflow.
( transitive , nautical ) To slack off a line .
